With the early visit of winter this year, white Christmas seems to be not that far way. The excitement starts to climb up; but with a little budget in the pocket, where and how should we celebrate (instead of complaining) the coming up cold cold winter time? Today Oranje Express want to share this wonderful winter activity "Kaarsjesavond(Candle light night)" in the city Gouda with our lovely audience.  

Gouda, a city is not only famous for it's internationally well-known cheese, but also for the production of candle light. Due to it's "natural  condition", since 1960s, on the second Tuesday in December every year, the city falls in a warm warm celebrating mood with numerous candlelight shining in the dark and cold winter night. This, is the "Kaarsjesavond". 

In "Kaarsjesavond", in churches and city governmental buildings,  there are different coffee corners, shows and workshops going on. In numerous galleries, museums and concert hall, you will find free exhibitions and performances. There also will be free historical city tour guide every one hour, "the walk" which will open your understanding towards to this old and important Dutch city. And of course, there will be also traditional Christmas market in the city everywhere. 

And the most exciting moment will be, without any doubt, in the evening, the moment when the city major lights up the Christmas tree (which is shipped from Norway), and tells a Christmas story to the crowd. And afterwards, the crowd will sing a Christmas carol all together followed by a light-show "on" city hall. 

Feel tempted? check for more information on their official website! If you already experience this event, please feel welcome to share your experience with us! (even the bad ones!)

[荷式政治/Dutch policy] (for English, please click "see more")

荷蘭兩大主政黨: 工黨(PvDA)和自民黨(VVD)最近在組閣研討過程中，對國家醫療保險的相關政策達到共識。兩黨希望於2014年全面取消醫療保險津貼。

相異於台灣的全民健保制度，荷蘭法律強制規定凡居住於荷蘭的居民，皆需要自行投保私人保險公司。每個保險公司都有提供依據政府所規定的基本醫療保險，而個人可因著自己的健康狀況而增加額外的保險項目（例如牙醫開銷等）。而同時，荷蘭政府制定按照個人收入而發放醫療費用津貼，從2006年發布此"新"規範至今，約有５千萬荷蘭人領取醫療津貼。換句話說，荷蘭保險是一種介於公共制訂與私人保險的制度，荷蘭政府負責監督健康保險的市場提供以及品質，卻將管理部分交給各個私人保險公司負責。

然而，目前即將執政黨的兩黨認為，醫療保費若是按照個人工資計算，按比例高收入人士交付較高醫療保險費用，低收入人士交付較低醫療保險費，這樣的貧富原則之下，政府不需要額外多發放醫療津貼。而取消醫療津貼將給荷蘭政府帶來每年45億歐元的經濟效益，荷蘭政府打算將這筆錢，透過下調工資稅的方式還給荷蘭民眾。目前荷蘭第三級工資稅是42%(也就使說如果一個人的收入一個月是2000歐，他要繳840歐給政府)，預計在2014年，搭配新的保險制度下，將調降為38%。


Currently, the Dutch health insurance system (since January 1st, 2006) is a semi-governmental regulated system. In stark contrast to many other European systems, the Dutch government is responsible for the accessibility and quality of the healthcare in the Netherlands but not in charge of its management. 

Every Dutch citizens and the ones who are on a long-term stay in NL are mandatory to insure themselves by one of the private health insurance company in Holland. Meanwhile, the government will refund  the partial cost of the medical care every month according to one's salary. 

However, the current two major political parties: VVD and PvDA decide to make some change of this regulation. They find out that if the charge of health insurance is according to one's salary, there is no need for the government to pay the allowance. In other words, if one's income is in the higher rank, the payment of his/her healthcare insurance will be higher. In this case, the Dutch government will save 4.5 billion of medial allowance every year. The new-coming up government (which is organized by VVD and PvDA) will return this amount of money back to the people by reducing income tax (the third level) from 42% to 38%. VVD and PvDA hope to start this new healthcare insurance in 2014. And so far, the Dutch mass welcome this new regulation.

<荷式燉牛肉配燉西洋梨 Stoofpeertjes met suddervlees>

秋天來了，今天荷事生非要介紹一頓經典的荷式傳統秋天料理，讓你吃的肚兒暖呼呼！這道「荷式燉牛肉配燉西洋梨」是荷蘭家庭裡常常出現的秋天菜色，如同照片所呈現，前方那黑乎乎的物體就是用五個小時燉出來的軟綿綿牛肉，搭配左後上方那團橘糊糊的肉桂西洋梨，最後加上荷蘭菜一定要的水煮馬鈴薯。三者不可缺一，效果是吃飽飽又笑嗨嗨（如果你是愛肉桂又嗜肉者的話啦...）。

烹煮過程其實很簡單，不過需要約莫半天的耐心時間。以下是來自荷蘭媽媽Marian提供的家常菜食譜，歡迎喜歡提增自己荷蘭道地性或是喜歡挑戰異國料理的捧油門嘗試看看囉！

A. 軟牛肉燉 suddervlees

1. 首先，去超市或是肉舖買上幾大塊 runderlappen (適合燉的牛肉)
2. 在肉塊上（盡量不要切）抹上適量鹽和胡椒
3. 找個有深度的鍋子，熱鍋後放入兩大匙奶油，把牛肉煎到有變色。
4. 加水，無須蓋過肉，但大概肉有一半以上是在水裡。
5. 轉小火，加蓋墩煮5-6小時。這其間除了突然想到的時候去翻一翻面之外，其他也就沒什麼事
6. 煮到肉是一撥就碎，恭喜你！已經好了！
p.s. 荷蘭人通常會保持牛肉一塊的完整性，在上桌的時候讓食用者自己享受隨手用叉子撥一撥牛肉就輕輕地化為一絲一絲的樂趣。

B. 荷式燉西洋梨 Stoofpeertjes 

1. 買上一大包的新鮮西洋梨（一個人約莫400-500克)
2. 去皮後洗淨切成四塊，不要等到乾，放入煮鍋裡
3. 蓋上鍋蓋後，在小火上烹煮。（這個階段大概是最需要心思的，要小心梨子不要燒焦，關鍵在於火候的控制，一定要夠小火，然後不定期的撥一撥）
4. 當你發現梨子開始變紅出水時，把火調到微火，或是把鍋子一到電子保溫爐上，讓它在那邊待個４小時左右。
5. 微火燉的過程中如果覺得梨子出水出到有一種彷彿要煮湯的感覺時，可以把一些水抝出。
6. 時間岔不多到，梨子已透出秋天深橘色時，（以５人量來說）加入半杯調過的玉米粉水，1.5大匙糖，和肉桂粉少許。
熱呼呼的燉西洋梨就大功告成啦！建議的是，因為花時間，小編都會一次煮一大鍋，配完牛肉後，把西洋梨冰起來，之後用來搭配香草冰淇淋，好吃到爆表！（到最後這個甜點功用變成作這道菜的真正動機...)

歡迎大家試試看後跟我們分享你的心得喔!

While the leaves are turning red, Oranje Express wants to share one classical Dutch autumn cuisine -- <Stoofpeertjes met suddervlees>!! This popular Dutch dish is composed by three important elements that none of it can be missed out: soft peer, soft beef and soft potato. 

This is the dish that is not only simple to make (except the unbelievable hours you will need to spend); but also that gives your stomach a solid warmth for the changing, moody and cold days out there. More and more, you can eat the dish in four different ways: 
- 3 in 1 all mixed (all-in kind); 
- beef mix with potato (classic kind); 
- peer mix with beef (adventure kind);
- peer mix with potato (why-not kind).

The recipe here is kindly provided by a Dutch mother, Marian van Es who made the best Dutch dishes in the world (according to me). Big Thanks to Marian! And so... let's go through this:

A.  Suddervlees (Dutch Beef Stew, for 5 ppl)
1. Get yourself some pieces of runderlappen(stewing beef) from the market.
2. Rub the meat with salt and pepper. (Suggestion: Don't cut the meat into smaller pieces. Leave the fun for latter.) 
3. Put the beef in a hot pan with melted butter (3 Spoons)
4. When meat starts to turn brown; turn to low fire; and add some water in the pan until half of the meat is in the watery gravy. 
5. Cover the pan up, and cook the meat for 5-6 hours with low fire. (During this time, nothing needs to be done except once a while turn the meat around to cook them evenly.) 
6. When the meat is so soft that just with one touch, it falls apart, then you are allowed to yell out "OH YES!!THE MEAT IS DONE!"

B. Stoofpeertjes (Dutch Peer Stew)
1. Get yourself (and the others) some fresh peers from the market. About 400-500 gram per person. 
2. peel them; cut them into 4 pieces and wash them. (Notice: do not dry the peer after the wash). 
3. Throw all the peers in one cooking pan, cover it up. Turn the small fire on for 1 hour. (Be aware of not to burn the peers. The keys are the small fire and stirring them once a while)
4. When you notice water starts coming out of peer, and peer starts to turn dark orange, you can turn the fire lower, and leave it for 4-5 hours. (Notice: during this period, if you notice there are too much water coming out of the peers, as if you are bowling soup, scoop some water out of the pan.) 
5. When it is about time when the color of peers turn into dark red, you add a half of cup's water mixed with corn flowers, 1.5 spoon of sugar, and some cinnamon powders in the pan. Stir them until you feel the peer start to get thicker. 
THEN YOU ARE DONE!!!

You can always make extra peer stews and put them in the fridge for later desert. The peer stew is a wonderful combination with vanilla ice cream. It is so delicious that there is no word to describe it but screams, seriously. 

We hope you will enjoy these wonderful autumn dish and welcome everyone to share their results with us!!!

!!警告：這是一篇烙烙長的討論文 (Warning: This is an unbelievably long post) 

荷蘭人從來不以浪漫多情出名，但對於愛情與婚姻這檔棘手難懂之事，荷蘭人也有著自己的獨特見解與困惑拉拔。做文化社會學的我，被荷蘭人的愛情觀深深吸引著，覺得這群以理性、實際為名的民族碰上了感性情感議題，所產生出的火花充滿著各式各樣的火花性。因此今天荷事生非想要和大家一起討論荷蘭人的結婚觀（不是婚姻觀喔！）。

在我的研究論文（討論荷蘭人的親密關係）中，20位荷蘭年輕受訪者在討論到未來婚姻這件事情時，有接近一半以上的他們說自己不確定婚姻的必要性，甚至大談究竟婚姻的意義是什麼。而小編自己身邊的年輕荷蘭朋友們，許許多多說了自己未來沒有結婚的打算，即便已經手中已經牽著那個人的手超過了好幾個年頭。「沒有什麼必要性」，通常這樣的簡單答案會落入耳中。

但這樣的想法其實並不簡單， 荷蘭人對於婚姻的質疑，就某程度來說，是反映出公民對於公權力過度涉及私人生活的反感。對許多年輕一代的荷蘭人而言（當然不只有年輕人），親密關係是依照兩人的互動相處模式，由兩個「參與者」來定義的，並不是法律，更不是一個來自法院的陌生人能可以宣告成形的。

這樣的想法並不是天外飛來一筆，而是在許多文化脈絡與歷史發展中所產生而成。（因為po文字數最好比兩萬字論文少一點，所以這邊簡單列出幾點...）
．首先，有鑑於自二戰後先人的高離婚率，「婚姻」這東西逐漸失去了它的神聖性與被信任性。人們開始問，如果結婚不再是一輩子快樂幸福在一起的有效保證，那它是什麼？

．如果說結婚才是開啟人生的新階段，可以自由地與伴侶擁有兩個人的小世界，但對於大多數荷蘭人來說，婚前同居是非常普遍的事情。自己獨立的空間、與伴侶生活在一起日子，並不是一件非得要等到結了婚才能夠擁有的事情。因此，許多荷蘭人問，如果結婚前跟結婚後日子都是這樣的過，為什麼要結婚？

．另外，雖然荷蘭到今天依然被認定為一個基督教國家，然而在過去20年內，信教人數大幅減少，特別是年輕一代中。歷史上在西方基督教國家，婚姻的制式化與宗教教條息息相關。然而，隨著人們對宗教的觀感有了劇烈性的改變，婚姻也逐漸失去它的宗教性意義與支持。

．最後，荷蘭法律上對於合法伴侶的定義提供了不只一種的選項，除了傳統的婚姻伴侶、還有登記伴侶、和同居伴侶共三種。法律上的空間，不只提供了荷蘭人可以自我定義其親密關係的空間之外，依然提供了不同伴侶關係的合法人身財產保障權益。那麼，荷蘭人問，結婚到底是為了什麼？

如同一位受訪者在談及結婚時說的：「對我來說，結婚這件事情並不會對我跟我男朋友的關係額外增添什麼。我們的關係就是我們現在的這個樣子。我已經選擇他就是那個我要分享的生活／生命的人，而我也已經正在和他共同建立一個生活。如果哪天，我們兩個誰不再願意這樣看待我們的關係，那麼結婚戒指也不會改變些什麼。妻子與丈夫，我覺得是一個很沉重的標籤。」
荷蘭社會隨著在相互成因的社會、文化、宗教、與制度的變遷，對於許多年輕一代的荷蘭人們，婚姻只是眾多親密關係的一種展現性，其必要性是一個讓人絞盡腦汁反思的問題。在這樣的思考邏輯中，愛情與婚姻，必沒有前後因果的必然關係。

下次有空，問問看你身邊（夠熟）的未婚荷蘭朋友同事們，他們對於結婚的必要性這件事情的看法。也歡迎你跟我們分享，即便是大不相同的想法！

Dutch people are hardly ever known for their exotic, bubbly-doopsy romantic-related characteristics. In fact, they are even more famous for the 'seemly opposite' of romantic: being realistic and practical. However, when it comes to love and marriage, this  "anti-romantic" group of people have some inspirational and interesting insights. And today, Oranje Express wants to discuss with all of you about Dutch people and their perception of getting married. 

Based on my personal research (on Dutch romantic relationships), the younger generation of Dutch individuals tend to question the meaning and the necessity of marriage. And more and more of them refuse to define their intimate relationships by a form so called marriage and by a stranger from the city hall.

To a certain level, these trends reflect a general orientation of deinstitutionalized private life. In simple words, in the process of individualization, public sectors (government, church, community...ect) have gradually lost their influencing power over individuals, particularly in those areas which are very clearly private defined, for example love. For Dutch young individuals (mostly but not only), the definition of a intimate relationship should be told by the volunteer participants, by their daily interactions, not by the public sector. 

From my understanding, such perception of marriage and intimate relationship should be seen from several dimensions and contexts: 
- First, it implies a direct fact that in contemporary society, marriage has gradually lost its sanctity of guaranteeing lifetime love and happiness as the old fairytale tended to tell us to. 

- Secondly, in Dutch society, cohabitation is very common before marriage. In this case, lovers have tasted/known how it is like to have a private-2-persons-world. The permission of having a independent and joined life no longer needs the permission given by the power of the marriage (nor the power of the state). 

- Although the Netherlands is categorized as an Christian society, the number of Christian has dramatically declined over the last two decades. In this sense, marriage has gradually lost its religious backbone to claim or convince the public its necessity. 

- Speaking of power of the state, Dutch law provides more than one form of legalizing an intimate relationship. Next to marriage, there is "registered partnership" and "cohabitation". There are minor differences between these three status of a legal couple. However, it provides a great space for individuals to interpret their relationships. 

All in all, the cultural, religious and institutional shifts in the Dutch society provide the young generation an environment to reflect upon the meaning of marriage. Like one of my respondents said: "For me, marriage provides nothing extra. We are the way we are now. I already see him as the man I will share my life with. And I am already doing that. If one day we both stop seeing our relationship this way, then even a married ring cannot change that. Husband and wife, those are too heavy words." For those respondents, marriage is just one status of a couple, out of thousands kinds. There's no defined cause-result relation between love and marriage. In a New Age saying: love exist in any kind of form, as long as that's the way you perceive it. 

So next time, ask one of your Dutch friend (who you think you are pretty close enough to ask this question) about his/her opinion of getting married. And welcome to share with us!

In Taiwan, spekkoek has been claimed as a kind of "royal Dutch cake" although most Taiwanese have no idea why this layered cake has anything to do with the Dutch and the lowlands. Some that have traveled to Indonesia, Singapore or Malaysia may have noticed that the local "Kuih Lapis" (or "Lapis Legit") resembles this kind of cake, but very few would suspect its origin. In fact, kuih lapis is originated from the Hakka "nine-layer cake" which is made by sticky rice and can be both sweet and savoury. It is enjoyed during the Chong Yang Festival (Double Ninth Festival) when the Chinese celebrate their tradition of honoring the seniors. In Chinese culture, numbers are all meaningful. "9" resembles longevity and advancement as it is the biggest number among the one-digits. Now you probably understand why this cake has to be made in nine layers. While this cake traveled south with the Chinese immigrants and had been flavoured and coloured by the local taste in south-east Asia, it also inspired the Dutch colonists. They too, had made it more more enjoyable according to the pastry style they are use to. Egg and flour replaced sticky rice; cinnamon, cardamon and clove spiced the original plain sugar taste. And the savoury version simply was not adapted (the only association can probably only be found by the name of "spekkoek" ;-). After several hundreds of years, this cake has traveled back to Asia with a very premium name "royal Dutch cake" due to marketing purpose, but who knows that the story actually begins right from here?

荷蘭，一望平坦無疑的三角洲地形，由三大河流萊茵（Rijn)、馬仕(Maas)、須德(Schelde)沖積而成。三分之二的國土在海平面下，在鹿特丹(Rotterdam)與豪達（Gouda)兩城市之間，荷蘭整個國家的最低點：負6.7公尺，大概就是地下B2停車場的那個深度。如果拿張簡易荷蘭地圖從右上畫條線到左下，左半邊的土地近乎皆低於海平面，而這個左邊，則是人口高密度的居住與商業活動城市們所在地。

自古早的羅馬時期荷蘭人就開始與水奮鬥，從當時的堆砌土丘開始，逐漸發展成隨處可見的河堤海堤，到17世紀技術普遍的抽水風車(在歐洲風車並非荷蘭特有，但荷式風車有名在它的排水功能與密集度），在圩田上的風車把水兒抽啊抽，地兒也就越來越低，造就了此時荷蘭低地國風景。（不過值得一提的是，在阿姆斯特丹市中心，這個歷史古老的城市留給後人的不只是繁榮發展，還有無止盡的垃圾堆積，因此即便其地理位置"應該在"海平面之下，此刻的阿姆斯特丹市中心卻稍稍的略勝海平面一小籌。)

即便荷蘭人治水的故事早已經過了好幾個百年，不過1953年1月底那場導致2551人喪生的北海洪水，讓荷蘭人與荷蘭水的關係不再一樣。當時荷蘭政府組織了第一屆三角洲工程委員會(Deltacommission），著手進行著名的水利工程計畫-「三角洲工程」(Deltawerken)。以全方位的角度規劃，超過４０年的竣工，融合整合性水資源管理的元素，重新擬定國土防洪與保育政策，著手更新水文地質與洋流的觀測紀錄，並且上修工程防洪設計標準。三角洲工程委員會依照計畫封鎖了海洋與內接觸的路徑，面對著北海設下重重關卡的水利防禦陣勢，從沿海堤壩到防潮閘門，其原則是設計出一個可以對抗一百世紀才會出現一次的超級海浪高度，保護著荷蘭西南方Randstad人口密集地區。

而同時，荷蘭當局也開始明白就算是層層關卡，也拒絕不了水的無形之力。因此，從將「惡水」拒絕門外，荷蘭人開始思考如何讓水與土地共生，他們提出了"go with the flow"這個概念。在思考性的突破之後，眼中呈現的不再是瘴癘之地的各項劣勢，而是各種土地上的發展與經濟上的優勢。荷蘭的水，是交通運輸的好管道；風車與河堤水壩能製造能源；運用圩田之力發展的花卉經濟、在國際上外銷水利工程知識、發名實驗新的工作與居住方式來適應這個水王國（水上公寓、船屋...)，荷蘭人的商業、實際性、創意腦袋，把國家的最大問題轉換成國家的發展動力。

荷蘭的水深深地與荷蘭人結合著，光是荷蘭政府在水資源管理的支出上，每年就超過３０億歐元（占人民及企業的總稅收70%），當我把這項資訊與我的荷蘭好友分享時，他走到廁所的水台邊，從水龍頭倒了一杯水給我，說：「請享用我們的付出與成就。」在天氣急速變遷的時候，住在非常低地區的我有時忍不住抱怨，說應該趕快買艘船以防萬一。我的荷蘭朋友大笑地回答我說："we have the best system in the world." 也許的確荷蘭人達到了它們所期許的了，那個土地與水共生的世界。

Q: Where is the lowest point in this lowland country?
(1) Scheveningen, Den Haag
(2) Rotterdam
(3) Gouda
(4) Schiphol Airport

A: In between the option 2 and 3. 

The lowest point in Holland is in between the city Rotterdam and the Cheese city Gouda, minus 6.7 meters. Hard to imagine? Next time if you take train from Rotterdam to Utrecht, checking the scenery outside the window. It will make much more sense, especially when you see the endless grass field with countless cow and sheep. 
Some Dutch people might tell you the answer of Princeland, a very cute neighborhood in Rotterdam. Please proudly correct the person, but not too rude. Because few decades ago, Dutch people really think it was the lowest point and built a memorial statue-ish thing there. "It is the second lowest," you may politely inform the person.

BTW, one last thing you might want to know as well, Schiphol is also under the sea level.

[荷式社會 Dutch Society] 荷蘭保險公司推倡健康新生活!Dutch Insurance Company says "hera! Healthy Life Style!!!"   
* For English, please click "see more"!

荷蘭一家知名保險公司最近推出了一系列新政策，把"健康生活方式"囊括入客戶評估系統當中。就以往，荷蘭保險公司能夠評估自家客戶，根據客戶的（壞的）健康狀況，例如：抽菸歷史、年齡、病史等，提高保險費用或甚至拒絕提供保險。這樣的保險過程經常引起糾紛或是荷蘭人大聲地抱怨！

近期這家知名保險公司把決定把優良的健康狀況也列入評估項目之中，若其客戶提申自己戒了菸、有規律的運動等正在從事"健康生活"，被保人可以依據它們的"優良行為"換得點數。這些點數，想當然耳，之後可用來扣除保費！

荷蘭人們開始紛紛在各個電視節目、新聞、廣播節目上討論這項在保險界裡的新政策，雖然普遍來說大眾非常歡迎這的新改變，然而卻也有不少人發現，這些"健康生活"在評估上是單純的"信任機制"，沒有辦法做二次審核的。也就是說，若有位大哥說他不抽菸每天運動30分鐘，那保險公司也沒法天天檢查他有無壞壞偷抽菸或是懶惰不運動。關於這樣的盲點，保險公司認為目前的“健康集點數＂只是個開端，接下來會一步一步往此方向設計更完整的機制，來進階鼓勵大眾健康。(期待中!)

Recently a major Dutch health insurance company has announced a new policy incorporating healthy lifestyle in one's insurance measures. According to the new policy, the clients who quit smoking, diet, or regular exercise could  earn "points", accordingly, and therefore, to reduce their insurance payment. Such incorporation is in the aim to promote healthy life style among the Dutch people. 

While in general Dutch public welcome and embrace such a new development after all the years of being charged, evaluated/judged and even rejected by insurance company according to one's lifestyle/medical history/age, some doubts still remain concerning the new policy. The main reason is that the new measurements is purely self-reported. In other words, once one client report he/she has quit smoking, without further inspection, the company is entitled to give "points". However, the company respond on such an issue, claiming this new measurement should be seen as a new start, new direction. In the recent future, an improvising mechanism and system will be build around such an idea of promoting healthy lifestyle. (Looking a little bit forward to that!)

[荷式政治/Dutch Politics]

2012年的荷蘭國會選舉在昨天9月13日半夜開票結束後畫下句點。這次的國會普選比預定的四年一選提早了２年，原因就在於在今年的４月，作為聯合政府管理黨三黨之一的自由黨(PVV)在縮減預算的政策下無法與另外兩個政府主政黨:自由民主黨(VVD)和基督教民主黨(CDA)組成共識，盡而導致由VVD黨主席Mark Ruute所領導的政府解散。(註一)

因此這次的國會選舉也是國會重選。2012年參選的政黨總共有２１個，根據2010年選舉結果的國會席次來看，荷蘭的最大五黨順序為：
-自由民主黨(VVD)
-勞工黨(PvdA)
-自由黨(PVV)
-基督教民主黨(CDA)
-社會黨(SP)
 (若以左右派基本劃分，VVD與CDA屬於右派，PVV則以極端右派為名；而PvdA與SP則屬於左派)

大選結果出爐後，VVD與PvdA兩黨大勝，分別獲得國會席次41與38席。兩大黨比起2010年的國會選舉席次明顯增加(10/8席)。這些席次，可以說是從CDA和PVV黨手中贏過來的，CDA和PVV兩黨在這次的選舉中分別失去了8/9國會席次。(許多荷蘭人認為這次CDA的大敗與其黨主席 van Haersma Buma這位大叔在選舉期間公開發表認為墮胎應該在荷蘭被禁止有關，van Haersma Buma甚至說出少數被強暴的婦女會懷孕，來批評這個經常被運用來支持墮胎合法化的論述，引起荷蘭社會與媒體的大肆報導與批評）。

在大選激情過後，更重要的步驟才正要展開：組織聯合政府。目前Mark Rutte確定繼續擔任荷蘭總理的職位。而兩大黨VVD和PvdA也開始討論合作的可能性，不過許多人實在不看好兩黨的合作性，畢竟兩黨在政治理念上大相逕庭，更在許多政策上採取完全不一樣的意見，例如對於保險市場、退休金、與歐盟預算/赤字條規上(詳情請參考http://www.dutchnews.nl/news/archives/2012/09/what_stands_between_the_vvd_an.php)。許多人也認為PvdA可以採取與其他較小的左派正黨聯盟（PvdA + SP + CDA + D66）。組織聯合政府與選取幕僚的過程可能花上2-4個月的時間，如果VVD與PvdA真的能夠共同合作，也算是突破了政治歷史上左右派對立劃分的關係，不過在政治實際面的考量上，很怕兩個政治立場對立的政黨組成共同政府之後，不久又解散政府的事件又再來一次。

註一：荷蘭政治黨派族繁不及備載，一黨獨大在國會選舉中能夠獲得一半以上的席次(76/150)的機會不高。因此在國會選舉完後，各黨會合作聯盟組成聯合政府團隊（也就是各黨席次加起來後超過76)，2010年國會大選後，荷蘭最大黨VVD與CDA合作組成政府，由VVD主席Mark Rutte領軍。特別的是PVV雖然作為政府管理黨之一，但它只願意提供部分的協助管理，意味著PVV黨員並沒有參與幕僚團隊，但卻持有政府主導權之一。

p.s:這篇荷蘭2012年國會大選報導是不熟識政治的小編從荷蘭媒體這邊看看那邊看看加上這邊問問荷蘭人那邊問問荷蘭拼湊出來的(感謝 Nicky van Es先生的分享)，若有專家們有更深層的了解，非常歡迎出聲分享或是指教！

[荷式態度 Dutchness] 昆蟲食譜 the Insect Cookbook/Het Insectenkookboek (for English, please click "See More"!)

是的，你沒看錯！這就是一本道地的昆蟲食譜！版主前一陣子在新聞中讀到，荷蘭Wageningen大學研究指出，昆蟲是比牛豬等動物更好、更環保的蛋白質來源，將在世界糧食大戰中扮演重要角色，且研究人員計畫推廣昆蟲料理。沒想到前兩天逛書店時，便赫然發現書架上安穩擺著這本"昆蟲食譜"！仔細翻了翻內容，實在是激賞荷蘭人的務實、坦誠和開放。不僅食譜的設計非以"讓讀者/吃客感覺不到這是昆蟲做的"的心態出發，食物攝影本身也毫不隱諱昆蟲的存在。有些料理將炸過的蟲蟲當成如油蔥酥般遍灑其上、有些則是以昆蟲構成本體，如昆蟲穀物棒、巧克力等。除了食譜以外，這本書中更收錄了許多研究學者、專家與大廚的訪談，以及介紹世界各國以昆蟲入菜的傳統(如墨西哥與中國西南省份)，除了展現嚴謹的學術精神外，更充滿了為世界未來找尋方向的熱誠。這也不禁讓版主重新思考，我們認為吃昆蟲是噁心、但吃其他動物是美味這樣的認知，究竟是如何被文化所馴養？除了文化以外、是不是也有許多非關理性的成分參雜其中(例如對多毛多腳的生物感到不自主的厭惡與恐懼)？你們覺得呢？

Do you mind eating worms/insects? Do you know that one day they can be your most important source of protein? Together with chef Henk van Gurp, two professors in Wageningen University recently launched an insect cookbook, promoting insect eating and cooking. It's getting more and more difficult to feed all people in the planet, let alone eating well. Research at the university has shown that insects can provide the best source of protein while meeting the needs of a rising population. In addition, insect production is much more environmental friendly than other livestock productions. Raising insects emits 100 times less greenhouse gas than raising pigs. Professor Marcel Dicke said that the launch of this cookbook is a step further to the introduction of insects on restaurant menus in the Netherlands. Besides solid recipes, this book includes interviews with researchers, food specialists, innovators and chefs who have been paying efforts on this issue and who have been making insect cooking more enjoyable and fun. The authors also try to justify their seemingly unusual attempt by introducing readers traditions of eating insects in different cultures. 
To be honest, although I still feel nauseous thinking having insects in my meat balls or on top of my quiche, I can hardly not applaud the establishment of this unique cookbook. The recipe editing and food photography are just so honest and outspoken. They simply were not developed to conceal the existence of insects in food. I see a blunt Dutchness in promoting something that is believed to be right, although it might stir many's stomach.

[荷式活動 Dutch Activity] Albert Heijn 125周年慶祝活動 / Wil jij boodschappen doen deze weekend? AH is celebrating its 125th anniversary! (for English, please click "see more"!)

昨天剛從阿姆斯特丹國立博物館(Rijksmuseum)看完doll house回來的版主，在回家的路上一如往常地順道逛進了AH，並且很順手地就花了27歐元。結帳的時候櫃檯小姐很親切地問我要不要gratis mini's，一向對AH各類collection活動有高度興趣的版主當然不會放過這個機會，所以便得到了兩個mini's。之後仔細一看才發現是AH為了慶祝125周年的最新活動，推出的迷你商品。回到家後拆封，發現得到了一個Heinz ketchup、另一個則是Bolletje的Echte Beschuitau麵包餅乾，真是可愛又逼真的令人心花怒放呀！雖然無法有錢地如17世紀的荷蘭商人建造自家的迷你模型，但逛超市的同時順道得到一些迷你模型也小小地滿足了觀賞與展示癖。剛剛連到AH的活動網頁(如連結)，才發現共有51個迷你商品可供蒐集，另外AH也有賣8.99歐的迷你商店(AH winkeltje)，是以在Zaanse Schans的第一家AH雜貨店為模型，讓蒐藏家與小朋友們也能在家開設自己的Albert Heijn商店。以一個marketer過來人的角度說，這真是一個經由品牌體驗強化品牌認同的高招呀！AH則藉由這個迷你商店與喚起大家對AH的歷史記憶，更能在荷蘭小朋友辦家家酒的過程中，把AH是超市第一品牌的形象不落痕跡地深植人心。不過迷你商品當然是由各家廠商贊助製作，但各品牌砸錢的回報則是能讓自家商品出現在家家戶戶、從小增加荷蘭小朋友的品牌認知(雖然最大的贏家仍是AH)。值得台灣的retailer學習！你們呢？來分享一下得到了哪些mini's吧！

Have you visited the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam? I just went there yesterday and was amazed by the delicate doll houses built by rich merchants in the Dutch golden age. On my way back home I visited Albert Heijn as usual and spent quite some money and got two branded product miniatures for free. It is a part of Albert Heijn's 125th anniversary celebration activities: for every 15 euros you spent, a free mini toy that features a brand product or groceries is given. For children or collectors, a mini Albert Heijn grocery shop (featuring the 1st AH shop in Zaanse Schans) can also be acquired (8.99 euros) in shops to get yourself a private exhibition of a "doll supermarket". There are 51 mini toys to be collected (as displayed in the attached webpage). Despite limited grocery items, mostly are branded consumer products. From a marketer's perspective, it is indeed a very smart strategy to enhance consumers' brand recognition. It can be especially effective to build brand loyalty from early childhood among children who collect and play with these mini toys and shops. Apart from that, the brand manufacturers must have shared/sponsored most of the cost for making those miniatures. For a retailer that carries so many brands, it is indeed a wise way to promote itself!

      Featured with four modern cinemas, a 1200 m2 exhibition space, educational facilities, offices, the Basement  which includes the digitized EYE collection and a restaurant-café, the film museum not only characterized with  its breathtaking appearance but also with its inner beauty: a enormous  body of precious collection:  46,000 film titles, 35,000 posters, 450,000 stills, 1.900 periodicals and 30,000 books.

[荷式建築 Dutch Architectural ] 阿姆斯特丹市立圖書館 Openbare Bibliotheek Amsterdam
(for English, please click "see more"!)

「這不是一座書的圖書館，而是一個資訊的圖書館。」
座落於阿姆斯特丹火車站的東方，這個歐洲最大的公立圖書館在2007年由荷蘭建築師Jo Coenen設計建造而成。阿姆斯特丹圖書館所代表的不只是建築設計的創新，更是融合了新媒體與資訊、開放空間、環保綠建築等概念所蓋建的一座透明、開放的美麗圖書館。
圖書館裡，空氣循環系統藏在天花板與地板間；在大面的玻璃窗與室內開放空間設計下，照亮系統與自然光有了完美搭配，不太人工、不太刺眼。這樣的設計讓圖書館本身成了一座完整的自我建築，看不見突兀的大型器具。而室內的軟體設計：藏書、多媒體影音、網路...等等，阿姆斯特丹圖書館突破了傳統對圖書館刻板印象，打造了一座充滿活力與知識可能性的環境！


"It's not a book library. It is a information library."

Current Amsterdam public library, the biggest public library in Europe, was designed by the famous Dutch architect Jo Coenen in 2007. The building itself represents a new dimension of architecture: a transparent and open building with holistic design. 
The energy system in the library is a robust control system that it allows the air ventilation becoming natural and without any big equipment occupying the inner space but hiding in between the ceiling and the floors. "The intelligence is in the design. It is not in the heavier equipment", said by one of the Director Jaap Wiedenhoff. The lighting system creates a illuminating environment within the building. The open space design in the building allows the travel of light and that people can see the entire structure of library within. More and more, the information access providing by Amsterdam Public Library is more than books, but including new media equipment and products while numerous computers are available. Library is not just a building, not just about book. Openbare Bibliotheek Amsterdam proves that.

Have you heard of the "Boekenweek" in the Netherlands? Do you know that you can travel for free with a book around the Netherlands? The <Heldere hemel> from the Belgian writer Tom Lanoye is your one-day ticket for NS tomorrow! 

According to an NS survey, about 75% of the Dutch travelers read on the train. Since train has become an important place for people to read, NS finds enough reasons to make it a more enjoyable experience. The Dutch railway (NS) is a sponsor of the "CNPB" (Dutch: Stichting Collectieve Propaganda van het Nederlandse Boek / English: Collective Promotion for the Dutch Book Foundation) and supports many interesting promotions on Dutch books and reading. The Boekenweek is one of the examples. It has been held for 10 years continuously. This year, if you spend 12.50 euros to buy a Dutch book during the event week (14th to 24th March, 2012) you'll get Tom Lanoye's <Heldere hemel> for free and the chance to travel through the Netherlands for free on 18th March (this Sunday) if you bring this book with you on the train. 

Do you also read on the train? Do you agree that it's a smart idea promoting Dutch books, reading habit and business at the same time?

[荷式文化 Dutch culture]   (For English, please click 'see more'!)
(警告: 以下內容充滿不雅之詞)
(warning: the following content is not suitable for children)

最近兩位版主都為了論文傷腦傷神傷心，為了配合一下這樣的氣氛(憤)，今天荷事生非決定要"口出惡言"- 與大家分享一下荷蘭非常獨特的髒話文化! 希望大家不要太介意接下來的"18禁"內容才好。

比起在中文和英文世界裡動不動就請出爹娘老師，或是使用性暴力、性器官字眼來咒罵他人或事物，荷蘭髒話裡最受歡迎也最powerful的就屬"疾病"ㄧ系列。荷蘭人習慣用詛咒對方得到這個疾病或是利用"疾病"來嘲笑他人以達到情緒抒發之目的。（當然，荷蘭髒話不只有疾病而已）

疾病髒話中，冠軍絕對是屬於"kanker" 一詞 (發音:康客er)！其實它就是癌症(cancer)的意思。它的髒話功能與重要性在中文裡可以用"幹"ㄧ字來做對應。kanker的使用方式非常彈性，只要在kanker後加上隨便你想加的受詞(例:+SPSS=kankerspss)，你就成功的咒罵了總能整死人也讓人上天堂的SPSS統計軟體。

除此之外，像癌症的關鍵角色"腫瘤"當然也在荷蘭髒話界裡也有一席地位： "hoofdtumor"(發音: 侯夫特東門) ，意為腦腫瘤也是抒發氣憤的經常選擇。另外像是古早的重大疾病：梅毒"typhilis"、天花"pokke"、肺結核"tering"也都算是"受歡迎"的用詞們，畢竟髒話絕對是大眾文化，而文化不是一天兩天的事情。

好了我怕在打下去我們幾位荷蘭的朋友要驚慌失措了，大家若有興趣，可以在維基上搜索"Dutch profanity"，那裡有一個世界。

Recent weeks both the bloggers of Oranje Express are suffering from a overload of studying. In order to celebrate such a wonderful time, we decide to swear...sorry, to introduce the one and only Dutch swearing culture to you. 

Of course Dutch people swear. But different than other language,  the words often used in Dutch profanity are based around various names for diseases. In many cases, these words have evolved into slang. This does not mean they don't have an array of other dirty swear words like the ones emerging in your mind now. But using names for disease is very in common and also unique in a way.

Above all, the word "kanker" is the king in Dutch swearing. It exactly means cancer. It is almost equally used as the word "fuck" in English. Additionally, tumor is also often used for cursing, "hoofdtumor" for example, which means brain tumor. Others like old century diseases: smallpox "pokke", Tuberculosis "tering", or Syphilis "typhilis" are also often used in Dutch swearing. 

So next time you heard people saying those words with an angry face. You know what they mean now. Well... theoretical speaking.

Have you ever wondered whether online self-check in your flight really makes a difference? After all, you still have to wait in line for your luggage to be checked-in too. It seems that your wish was heard. Six new self-service baggage drop-off units in Amsterdam Schiphol airport are now available for KLM and its Sky Team passengers. I used this service half a year ago when heading  to Berlin. Indeed, it saved some time queuing, but you might still need help from the staff as it is new and sometimes not as sensitive. The most interesting thing is, as it is called "self-service", it's treated as a service to the customers ("we offer you a more convenient and pleasant experience") but not a strategy to reduce the company's service cost. As a result, travelers could hardly share the benefits when they buy the tickets.

[荷式文物保存 Dutch Heritage Preservation] 安妮之家 Anne Frank's House (for English, please click "see more")

大家都是在什麼年紀讀到安妮日記的呢？我大概是在小學時讀到她的文字。可能是安逸的生活使然，那時候顯然還不能理解，只因為自己身為某一種人，就必須面對大屠殺、終日躲躲藏藏、擔心生命不知會在哪一秒終結的命運，直到2007年我終於造訪了她曾經藏身兩年的居所。安妮之家和阿姆斯特丹的許多住宅一樣，矗立在一條靜謐、波光粼粼的運河旁邊，但是這棟房子內，隱藏的不只是令人驚奇的荷蘭房屋構造、還有八個人、兩個家庭的生命故事。我還清楚記得，當我通過那個祕密書櫃、親自走過那個狹長的樓梯、踏入安妮和家人躲藏的密室時，想起曾經在這裡活過、然後莫名消逝的人們，一時激動得無法言語。

不知道大家去過安妮之家了嗎？連結中的安妮之家網站，於2011年獲得有「網路界奧斯卡」之稱的Webby Awards。該網站運用3D與多媒體技術、及多個珍貴影片，重現這個充滿驚奇、愛、希望、絕望與背叛的秘密角落。去過的你，可以在線上回味當時的震撼；沒去過的你，現在只要動動手指頭，就能用安妮的眼睛，仔細看一次這個曾經見證她年輕生命，容納她易感的心、卻又無力永久保護她的地方。

Have you ever read Anne Frank’s Diary? How old were you? I encountered her life story when I was pretty young, too young to understand her ridiculously destined fate. I also had limited knowledge on the massacre of Jews then, therefore her story didn’t really touch me until I visited her hiding place in year 2007. Anne Frank’s House from the outside looks just as other normal Dutch residences that quietly stand beside a canal. Yet the door hides not only an amazingly designed house but also a story of 8 individuals and 2 families. Breathless I was, walking through the secret bookcase, climbing the steep staircase, and finally stepping into the hiding place, thinking of her and her family’s existence. 

Have you visited Anne Frank’s House? How was your experience? Now the hiding place is restored online with 3D techniques, enhanced with precious videos and other multi-media materials. Awarded by the International Academy of Digital Arts and Sciences, the Secret Annex online has won the Webby Award in the category Best Cultural Institutions last year. It leads you to the place where a young girl had lived, laughed, dreamed, hoped and perished. Give a click now and listen to the story of Anne and those who shared a similar path.

[荷式料理 Dutch cuisine] (for English, please click more, not the translation!)

最近整個歐洲零下冷呼呼，今天荷事生非想要介紹在寒冷冬天裡，荷蘭人最愛的一道冬天料理：荷蘭碗豆湯，de Erwtensoep！
這碗豆湯湯如其名，難念的要命煮起來更是要花一頓工夫。但這個似湯又似粥，遠看更像燉菜的荷蘭碗豆湯，真的在寒冷的冬天裡是一個好選擇，小小一碗湯不僅能夠暖暖暖到你的心腸胃，它充滿了當地冬天的蔬菜和肉類，讓你喝飽能量高健康好，而且.....超！好！吃！(是鹿特丹版主最愛的ㄧ道荷蘭菜)

接下來我們要長篇大論的告訴你怎麼在家自己做這道功夫菜，但在這之前，先分享一位荷蘭媽媽提供的小秘訣：要判斷什麼才是成功的道地荷蘭碗豆湯？如果你的湯匙插進湯裡而不會倒(如圖示)，恭喜恭喜！！你就成功啦！！！

另外，這道湯其實荷蘭大多的肉舖都有在賣現成手工作好的(當天冷凍起來)，偷懶的人們啊～快去肉舖買現成的回家加熱就可以享受這道道地的荷蘭料理囉！現在我們就來介紹這道菜的食譜，提供給想挑戰看看的廚藝大師吧！(p.s. 這道料理的食譜網路上都可以找得到，但因為這道菜是荷蘭的家常菜，所以每個人做法都有不同喔！)

**荷蘭碗豆湯食譜**(4人份料裡，料理時間：約3小時)

<食材>
300g    撥好的碗豆
400g    豬肩肉
2片     月桂葉
1小把   西洋芹葉子(大約8根)
3塊     蔬菜湯塊
200g    芹菜根 (如果沒有可以直接以芹菜取代)
2個     (軟)馬鈴薯
2個     洋蔥
200g    荷蘭韭菜
300g    紅蘿蔔
1小把   新鮮巴西利葉 (約5根)
1條     煙燻香腸 (rookworst)
1匙   液狀奶油
鹽和胡椒

<做法>

1. 把碗豆、豬肩肉、月桂葉、一半的西洋芹葉子、高湯塊、2公升的水全丟進一個大鍋裡，加點鹽。
2. 水煮滾後轉小火煮約45分鐘
3. 同時間可以把芹菜根和馬鈴薯去皮切成小塊狀。
4. 把切好的芹菜根和馬鈴薯丟入已經煮了30分鐘的湯底裡。
5. 一旁把所有食材切好：洋蔥去皮切碎；荷蘭韭菜洗淨切細環狀；紅蘿蔔去皮切成小塊狀；剩下一半的西洋芹葉和巴西利葉切細碎；香腸切片。
6. 把湯裡的月桂葉、西洋芹葉撈出丟掉；把豬肉挑出來切成更小的塊狀，把肥肉和軟骨切除。
7. 另起一鍋將液狀奶油加熱後炒香洋蔥(約3分鐘)，加入切好的荷蘭韭菜、紅蘿蔔、西洋芹菜葉、巴西利葉、香腸、和切成更小塊的豬肉稍微炒香。
8. 把步驟8的料理加入湯裡，均勻混合。
9. 煮30分鐘，如果湯太濃，可以加點水調適。
10. 最後已鹽和胡椒調味。

完成！！！！！
碗豆湯和烤好的熱熱麵包很對味唷!
(歡迎板友們分享自己的努力成果，或是推薦哪裡可以喝到好喝的碗豆湯唷)

How are we going to survive from this OMG cold cold winter (week)??? Today Oranje Express is going to introduce you one of the classic Dutch winter cuisine: the Dutch pea soup (de Erwtensoep)!! Different from the other pea soup, Dutch pea soup is famous for its unique thickness (just like a stew I would say...) and cooked by local ingredients. Every Dutch family, well... most Dutch families, enjoys the pea soup during the cold winter time since it is not just a pea soup but the soup filled with all kinds of energy resources!

So now... before we start to introduce the pea soup recipe, according a Dutch mom, the secret to tell whether or not the cup of soup is successful... just stick a table spoon in your soup! If the spoon can stand still without falling in the soup, then... CONGRATULATION! It is a good cup of Erwtensoep!!  

Here's the recipe for all the brave kitchen masters who dare to take the challenge. However, since Erwtensoep is a home dish, every household has their own special recipes. And the following one is just one of them. :)

** Erwtensoep (4 people; about 3 hr cooking time)
<Ingredients> 
300g split peas 
400g pork trotter chops 
2 bay leaves 
8 sprigs celery leaves
3  vegetarian bouillon cubes  
200g celeriac (or stick celery)
2 potatoes 
2 onions 
200g leeks 
300g carrot 
5 sprigs parsley 
1 smoked sausage (rookworst)
1 tbsp Blue Band Liquid (may also be other butter) 
salt pepper

< Preparation >
1. Put the split peas, pork chops, bay leaves, 4 sprigs of celery leaves, bouillon cubes and 2 liters of water in a pan　with some salt.
2. Bring to the boil and simmer for approx 45 minutes on low heat.
3. Meanwhile, peel the celeriac and potatoes and cut them into cubes.
4. After 30 minutes, add them to the peas.
5. Peel and chop the onions. Clean the leeks and cut them into rings. Peel the carrot and cut into cubes. Cut the parsley and the rest of the celery finely. Cut the sausage into slices.
6. Take the meat out from the soup. Remove the fat and the soft bones; cut it into smaller pieces.
7. Remove laulierblaadjes, celery and parsley in the soup.
8. Heat the margarine. Saute the onion about 3 minutes. Stir in leek, carrot, celery, parsley, sausage, meat and soup mixture.
9. Add water if soup is too thick.
10.Cook for about 30 minutes with low fire. Season with salt and pepper.

AND... DONE!!

please feel more than welcome to share your work with us or introduce us where can we find delicious Erwtensoep!

These two books are known as "grandpa/grandma book". They are usually presents form the grandson/daughters (or precisely their parents) to the "opa/oma". The book is filled with various unique and personal questions to let the grandparents write down their life stories and return back to the kids afterwards. By doing so, the grandchildren get to know their grandpa and grandma better, the family history also has its way to continuously pass on generation by generation with well-written record. I found the concept of the book is so brilliant and so warm. <3

I found this weird 'warning sign' from Kralingse Park, Rotterdam where is one of the most recommended location to go to in Rotterdam. Kralingse Park, or Kralingse Bos is a huge city park (2 square km) which is consisted by forest, lake, (hardly a) beach, and two old windmills. It is very popular among the locals to hangout with friends, families, and lover(s) in all four seasons. Due to the size of the park and the fact that it is less well-known tourists, Kralingse Park share its wide-open space and beautiful scenery with every visitor.

【TEWA綜合報導/2012.01.16/荷蘭的漂浮城鎮】超過三分之一的國土低於海平面的荷蘭，在過去的幾百年間，發展出高度錯綜複雜的排水工程系統令世人驚嘆。但是全球的氣候變遷，卻帶來更大的挑戰。根據估計，在本世紀末以前，荷蘭海平面將昇高65至130公分，這對低地國的生態影響將會是全面的：除了水患的問題，還有土壤、植物、淡水，以及能源的供給。。。

曾經與海爭地的荷蘭，現在探討建造能適應自然變遷、與水共生的城鎮：漂浮屋建隨著水面昇降，因此可以避免水患的威脅。但好處不僅與此，漂浮建築不再需要耗費大量能源〈以及因此排放的氣體〉在低窪地持續大量抽水，還可以進一步節省能源利用所處的水面為漂浮屋進行冷暖空調。

目前除了供人居住的漂浮屋、漂浮公寓，包括鹿特丹、阿姆斯特丹等城市都有興建漂浮公共建築的計劃。

未來的荷蘭，或許有更多的水面，但人們生活的空間未必會減少；聰明地與自然更和諧相處，不僅是為了面對氣候變遷的挑戰，也是荷蘭用創意找尋出路。

有意思的是，每台機器的旁邊都有一個對照表，列出所有車款的輪胎氣壓值，貼心得讓你清楚應該要給自己車子輪胎打到多飽。荷蘭人追求精準以即有效率的態度，可以從這個小機器一窺而知。

In every gas station in Holland, you can always find this tire-pumper. At the side of the machine, you  find the reference list to tell you how much air you should put in  based on the model of your car. It is accurate, efficient, and costing your money (for 50cent), just like everything else in Holland!

[荷蘭社會 Dutch Society] 你能想像一個沒有紅燈區的阿姆斯特丹嗎？Can you imagine Amsterdam without the red light district? (For English, please click "See More")
阿姆斯特丹紅燈區愈加猖狂的犯罪行為諸如洗錢、販賣人口等，讓市政廳下定決心要逐步縮減櫥窗女郎和大麻商店的數量。這個名為1012的十年計劃從2008年開始執行，直到今年才逐漸收到成果。阿姆斯特丹當局已經從480個櫥窗女郎中縮減100個，預計還要再縮減另100個；而為數76家的大麻商店也將減至26個。阿姆斯特丹的代理市長，同時也是1012計劃的領導者Lodewijk Asscher說：「阿姆斯特丹向來是個自由寬容的城市，但我們如今更希望將重心擺在文化與博物館上，以吸引更多家庭和遊客在這多留一晚。」你覺得呢？大麻的氣味和惹火的櫥窗女郎對你來說也是自由寬容的象徵嗎？你認為自由和寬容有上限嗎？你又怎麼為個人自由及公眾自由劃定界線呢？
Amsterdam City Council is determined to cuts the number of window brothels and coffee shops due to the burgeoning crimes associated with human trafficking, drug and money laundering. The project named 1012 kicked off in 2008 and aims to close down 200 window brothels and 50 coffee shops. Tangible results are finally seen this year. 100 windows were out while the next 100 are on their way. Lodewijk Asscher, the deputy mayor of Amsterdam and the 1012 project leader has claimed that "Amsterdam has always been a free and tolerant city, but we want to place more emphasis on museums and culture. We want to attract more families and encourage visitors to spend an extra night here." What do you think? Do you also associate the smell of cannabis and the sexy window girls with tolerance and freedom? Do you agree that there should be a limit for tolerance and freedom? How do you draw a line between the individual freedom and the public one?

荷蘭BNN電視台的新電視節目" Proefkonijnen" (白老鼠)最近播出一相當驚悚的內容預告：兩位主持人Dennis Storm和Valerio Zeno在節目上公開吃對方的肉。主持人之一的Storm宣稱，這節目是希望以簡單直接的方式，回答那些稀奇古怪的問題，譬如"人肉吃起來是什麼味道？"。Storm和Zeno兩人去醫院各切了臀部和腹部附近的一小塊肉，然後請大廚以葵花油簡單煎烤，接著在對方面前互相吃了對方的肉。但BNN電視台稍晚澄清，說這只是一個玩笑，他們的目的是為了喚起公眾注意器官捐贈的短缺問題。你覺得呢？
BNN-TV (a Dutch TV station) recently aired a teaser of their new TV show "Proefkonijnen" (literally "test rabbits"/guinea pigs), in which two hosts, Dennis Storm and Valerio Zeno appeared to eat each other's flesh. Storm claimed that their program aimed to provide really simple answers to some stupid questions, such as how human flesh tastes. He said that they went to a private clinic in Brabant and removed one piece of their flesh, one from buttock and the other from belly. They had the flesh cooked by a top chef with sunflower oil and then ate in front of each other, without adding salt or pepper. BNN later announced that this was just a "hoax" and their real claim is to raise the public awareness of the shortage of organ donations. What do you say?

Serious Requesti這個活動是荷蘭年輕人每年都會關心的盛會。由荷蘭當地電台3FM主辦。活動內容主要是由3FM的3個DJ進入一間玻璃屋在裡面住一個禮拜，不能走出玻璃屋，也不能和家人見面。活動規定他們只能喝水和果汁，不能吃東西(有點像是飢餓30活動)。在玻璃屋裡他們主要是輪班24小時接受民眾點歌，並在玻璃屋裡面的錄音室放音樂。全程都會有電視台直播他們在裡面的生活。活動的目的是向大眾募款，捐助給需要幫助的人。
今年的活動在Leiden舉辦，前天晚上是3位DJ的入關日，在入關之前，電視台訪問了三位DJ心情之類的(我聽不懂)，然後還有一些明星前來打氣加油，甚至還有荷蘭王子!!另外電視台主持人還邀請3位DJ的女朋友或老婆來加油，並贈送印有女友肖像的枕頭套(XDDDD)，訪問結束之後，由知名樂團snow patrol負責鎖門，鎖門那一刻，全體歡呼(好像很高興有人被鎖在裡面XD)。
這個活動似乎持續幾年了，在一些大都市都有辦過，算是相當知名的活動。除了DJ募款之外，他們似乎也會和一些藝術家團體合作，將一些創作品以拍賣的方式募款，相當有趣喔!! Leiden的朋友們，趁聖誕節前可以去廣場看看喔!!

PS. 我滿喜歡這個電台的，這些DJ很專業，放的音樂都很好聽喔!!

"Nederland van boven"，" 荷蘭上方"，是公共傳播公司VPRO近期推出的電視節目。在節目中，荷蘭人從"遠觀"的角度:衛星上空，觀察自己國家的在"平面上"看不見的日常生活，從國鐵NS系統，港口運輸，到每天的交通流動，和建築建造，因著現代科技的可能性與普眾化，"荷蘭上方"提供觀眾一個完全新的自我檢視角度！節目裡空中鏡頭的運用與衛星纜視的畫面都很驚人！雖然節目依然是荷語介紹，但隨著畫面的進行，有興趣的朋友還是可以享受不同的"荷式"視覺效果唷!

撥出時間: 每週二晚間10:20在公視Nederland 1
節目時間: 30分鐘
官方網站:http://nederlandvanboven.vpro.nl/afleveringen/handel.html
p.s: VPRO公共傳播是荷蘭最有規模與歷史的公共傳播組織之一，他們打造了無數個在荷蘭受歡迎的節目，即便VPRO的基督教創建背景，如今VPRO被譽為荷蘭傳播界裡最文化激進、敢說有遠見的傳播公司之一! 有空可以瞧瞧他們的網站唷!
VPRO: http://weblogs.vpro.nl/nieuws/

"Nederland van boven", "Netherlands from above" is one of newest television program produced by VPRO, a famous Dutch broadcasting organization. The show introduce the audience a new perspective- from above the sky, to see the daily lives in Holland. 
From the traffic on the freeway everyday, NS train system, to the nature, the water, the building, the leisure activities, "Nederland van boven"  aims to search for the rhythms and patterns of everyday lives on this lowland, showing how Netherlands over the years have made, how Dutch people operate, relax, work, and build the cities and decorate their landscape from a "bird" view. 
Within the show, very cool air-camera and satellite live zoom in and out to create this fancy and high-techo images to allow the audience enjoy this new perspective. Although the program is presented in Dutch (of course..), but the images themselves already tell a great stories! So, if your interested in plus happen to have a television in the house, go check it out!

The show is aired on every Tuesday 22:20 on Nederland 1 public channel, with 30 mins duration. 

the official website of "Nederland van boven": http://nederlandvanboven.vpro.nl/afleveringen/handel.html

[鹿特丹Rotterdam]
(for English, click "read more" !!)
這個聖誕老公公是Paul McCarthy的公共作品之一! (是McCarthy不是披頭四的McCartney唷)
Paul McCarthy是位美國的現代藝術家&行動份子。在他的作品當中相當強調"戲弄"這個元素。他經常利用藝術作品來批判、諷刺現今社會中的商業化消費性意識。這個聖誕老公公雕像，別名Buttplug Gnome(陽具侏儒)，是他受邀於International Sculpture為城市空間所設計的作品，最後由鹿特丹市議會買下。但因為作品本身太過爭議性，所安置老公公的地點成為了一個問題。
聖誕老公公在鹿特丹不斷流浪了好幾個地方，從一開始的Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen ，到Schouwburgplein的戲院前方廣場(最後因為附近商家的反對)，最後這位"性感"老公公終於被安置在 Eendrachtsplein 捷運站的廣場。

雖然老公公手上的＂巨物＂老是被聯想成陽具玩偶，但有些人還是認為那明明是個簡單的聖誕樹，更有人認為巨物像是對阿姆斯特丹的出名的二戰紀念碑的ㄧ種諷刺（在荷蘭，如果你是鹿特丹人，你就得討厭阿姆斯特丹人），因此甚至認為這是鹿特丹的精神象徵(fuck Amsterdam!!)

下次有空到鹿特丹，再有空經過Eendrachtsplein，繞過去看看這位流浪老先生吧！

＊Paul McCarthy的Wikipedia資料:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_McCarthy

This Santa Claus Statue is the work of McCarthy, an American artist and activist! 
McCarthy seeks to uproot and unmask the false realities of politics and commercial practices through his art works by using the element of "playfulness"  in his works. 
The Santa Claus Statue, aka the Buttplug Gnome, was originally commissioned by the International Sculpture [1] for a place in the city. The city Council of Rotterdam bough the statue afterwards. However, due to the controversial sexual connotation of the statue, the location for Mr. Santa was a big problem at the time. After rejected by Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen and Schouwburgplein square, at the end, the statue finally found where it belongs: Eendrachtsplein! 
The "thing" in Santa's right hand, although usually is associated with dildo, sometimes has different interpretations! For example, some Rotterdamer considers it is the symbol to mock the WWII memorial statue in Amsterdam, since in Holland, if you are from Rotterdam then you must hate Amsterdam... So, what do you think the thing is after all?? 
If you are interested in Paul McCarthy's work, check more information on Wikipeida:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_McCarthy

每年的12月5日是荷蘭的Sinterklaas(聖尼古拉斯節)。12月5日晚上(Sinterklaasavond)是親朋好友團聚的期間，除了互贈禮物之外，收禮者還會得到一首專門為她/他而寫的詩。

Sinterklaas就是4世紀時拜占庭帝國Myra的聖尼古拉斯(Sint Nicolaas van Myra/Saint Nicholas of Myra)，他被視為聖誕老人的前身。雖然聖尼古拉斯的家鄉是現代的土耳其，但在荷蘭傳說裡，每年11月中他會從西班牙搭乘蒸氣船來到荷蘭，並在他的助手黑彼得(Zwarte Piet)的幫助下，帶給乖巧的小朋友禮物和糖果，並在12月5日後返回西班牙。

你認為黑彼得的存在是種族歧視的象徵嗎？今年在Sinterklaas抵達Dordrecht的時候，有兩位"Zwarte Piet is Racisme"(黑彼得是種族歧視)的支持者被警方逮捕，雖然他們除了穿著印著該口號的T恤外什麼都沒做。(不)令人意外的是，龐大的商業利益似乎才是這個傳統最有力的支持者。
Do you regard the century-old Dutch tradition with Zwarte Piet racism? Two supporters of the movement "Zwarte Piet is Racisme" (Black Pete is racism) were arrested by the police only because they wore T-shirts with the slogan across chest when Sint arrived Dordrecht this November. (Un)Surprisingly, business seems to be one of Zwarte Piet's strongest supporters.

[Sinterklaas特輯] a Dutch Sinterklaas song "Zie ginds komt de stoomboot" (Look, here comes the steam boat!) depicting the arrival of Sinterklaas. Can you sing with all the Dutch children? Have you noticed that the naughty children actually get a "roe" as a punishment rather than nothing as said in the English translation of this song? Besides, the Dutch apparently forgot to "polish" the story of Piet and still call him "zijn knecht" (his servant) rather than a "helper" as suggested in the English version.

一首在荷蘭人人耳熟能詳的Sinterklaas兒歌"Zie ginds komt de stoomboot"(看哪，Sinterklaas的蒸汽船來了！)。你也會唱嗎？附上荷文歌詞與英文翻譯如下。偷偷說，英文歌詞沒有翻出來的地方是，淘氣不乖的小朋友不僅得不到糖果，還會得到樹枝做成的鞭條做為懲罰喔。而且荷文歌詞裡的"knecht"直翻其實就是"servant/僕人"，而不是英文加以美化過的"helper"。

<Zie Ginds Komt de Stoomboot>
Zie ginds komt de stoomboot
uit Spanje weer aan.
Hij brengt ons Sint-Nicolaas
ik zie hem al staan.
Hoe huppelt zijn paardje
op het dek op en neer,
hoe waaien de wimpels
al heen en al weer.

Zijn knecht staat te lachen 
en roept ons reeds toe:
"Wie zoet is krijgt lekkers,
wie stout is de roe!"
Och lieve Sint Niklaas, 
kom ook eens bij mij,
en rijd toch ons huisje 
niet stil voorbij.

<Look Here Comes the Steamboat>
Look, here comes the steamboat
from far a-way lands.
It brings us St. Nicholas,
he's waving his hands.
His horse is a-prancing
on deck, up and down,
The banners are waving
in village and town.

His helper is laughing 
and tells ev'ry one,
"The good kids get candy,
the bad ones get none!"
Oh, please dear St. Nich'las, 
do ride your white horse,
just visit our house,

[-荷式在角落-冬日街景] Oliebollen

Have you had some oliebollen already? Do they also appear on your dining table at New Year's Eve? How many can you eat at once?

每到冬天就會出現的Oliebollen華麗餐車，它受歡迎的程度和台灣路口賣雞蛋糕、炸雙胞胎的攤子如出一轍。不僅口味、口感與炸雙胞胎接近，美味"多脂"的程度也不相上下。Olibollen是以麵粉、雞蛋、糖、酵母等製作的圓球型麵點，經高溫油炸而成，要吃之前再灑上一層雪白的糖粉。經典的口味包括葡萄乾、蘋果(appelbollen)等。

Olibollen是荷蘭傳統在年夜時吃的點心，習俗源自古代日耳曼異教徒的冬至慶典(Yule，同時也是聖誕節的原型)。據說冬天的女神Perchta會揮劍砍向路上所見所有人的腹部，但若吃了油炸的oliebollen，其中所富含的油脂會讓女神的劍走滑失準，因而能保住性命。雖然台灣的冬天並未如歐洲般苦寒，傳統中我們也從未將冬天與死亡相連結，但來些美味的油炸小點、享受它撫慰人心的效果是不需要理由的！

[-荷式在角落-冬日街景] Christmas wreath hung, here comes the festive season!

配戴聖誕花圈的荷蘭老房子：雖然從外觀都看得出已經傾斜，但還是不服輸地換上新裝，再搭配底下洶湧的購物人群，正式宣告聖誕(購物)季節的到來！

(附贈荷蘭購物指南)
大部分的荷蘭商店(餐廳除外)在周日是不開門營業的，除非有取得營業特許(如超市或藥局等商家)。一般商店只有在每月的第一個周日是koop zondag (shopping sunday)營業。但從11月中Sinterklaas來臨之後，一直到聖誕節前，Utrecht的每個星期日都是koop zondag！再搭配聖誕節折扣，看來又會是一個貨真價實的血拼季節！

如果你想要花錢體驗這個奇怪巧妙的建築物有兩種方法：1. 花兩歐以及10分鐘參觀樣品屋。2. 花約莫25歐左右享受一晚住在這個非常空間的建築物中!
